Robot

Class LightLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Robot.LightLocalizer

  • public class LightLocalizer
extends Object
    This class accomplishes the task of Localization using the lightsensor and gridlines.

    It is responsible for using lightsensor readings to detect grid lines and then using the odometer, determine at what heading these lines get detected.

    Most of the variables are private. It uses many public variables from Main. The methods are private and non-static.
    Author:
    Thomas

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightLocalizer

        public LightLocalizer()
        Constructor for LightLocalizer class. Takes no inputs but inherits many variables from Main.

    • Method Detail

      • doLocalization

        public void doLocalization()
        The method does light localization. The angles (as reported by the odometer) at which we detect the black lines are used to figure out an absolute heading. 0 is in the positive x axis.

        As well, light localization can determine absolute x and y relative to the board.

      • getFilteredData

        private int getFilteredData()
        Gets the most recent color sensor value. Scales it by 100 and returns that value
        Returns:
        Color sensor value from 0-100. Higher values mean more light (lighter).

      • moveToLocalizingSpot

        private void moveToLocalizingSpot(Navigator navi)
        Move to the localizing spot using navigator. The localizing spot is 11cm along the 45 degree line.
        Parameters:
        navi - The navigator object that will be used to turn the robot.

      • toDegrees

        private double toDegrees(double angle)
        Takes an angle (in radians) and returns the same angle but in degrees.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle in radians to be converted
        Returns:
        The same angle in degrees

      • rotateCounterClockwise

        private void rotateCounterClockwise()
        Rotates the robot counter-clockwise. The rotation speed of the wheels are ROTATION_SPEED (in deg/s).

      • convertDistance

        private static int convertDistance(double radius,
                  double distance)
        Converts linear distance that you want a wheel to rotate into a value that stores the rotations (in degrees) that the wheel needs to rotate.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the wheel.
        distance - The distance you want a wheel to rotate.
        Returns:
        An int that stores the rotation (in degrees) that a wheel needs to rotate.
